DESPAIR LAMINATORS

"The edges hold. That's more than most things offer."

You send us the paper trail of your ordinary failures. The grocery list from the week it fell apart. The parking ticket from the day you found out. The rejection email you printed because deleting it felt like letting them win. We laminate it. Industrial-grade polyester film. Ten mils of glossy protection against time, weather, and the slow erosion of pretending it didn't happen.

Nobody memorializes the small losses. We build shrines to big grief but the stuff that actually hollows you out — the lukewarm performance review, the text that just said "ok" — that dissolves. It disappears into the recycling bin and you're supposed to move on. We don't think you should have to move on from something just because it was printed on cheap paper.

I started this company in 2012, the year Judith from HR handed me my layoff notice and I accidentally fed it through the laminator instead of the shredder. That sealed document is still in my wallet. It outlasted my marriage, my dog, and three separate lease agreements. The edges hold.

Toledo, Ohio. Since the incident.
